p.s: In the quality newspaper article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, dont that was published in The Telegraph on 27 January 2015, John Worne argues why British students should learn more foreign languages.
The author starts his article with pointing out his view how the situation of speaking foreign languages in the UK is.
Not enough students would be learning them.
Languages would be teached at more primary schools now and still the results in exams would not enhance.
Speaking English would not be enough and you still face many challenges in life not knowing any other language.
Even the UK's future prosperity would depend on learning languages and the majority of UK businesses would need foreign language skills.
There would be progress at universities that would be offering language courses but not enough students would take the opportunity to take part in it.
The autorauthor closes his text with his opinion that it would need parents, not only the education system, to bring more children to learn foreign languages.
